means: 中庸，智能学识平凡的人

PerfectNetExp.abs: 英语新词汇与常用词汇的翻译 - 外国语 -... ... middleaged 中年的 middlebrow 中庸 middleman 中间人.
献给圣诞节的礼物---小熊的G词总结 - 第4页 ... ... lowbrow 无文化修养的人 middlebrow 中产阶级趣味的人 incumbent 任职者.
格林伯格后来认为，对前卫艺术构成威胁的，并不是什么庸俗艺术，而是“中庸艺术”（middlebrow）。其实，在《前卫与庸俗》一文中…

list.abs: 那么在美国本土呢？米奈利经常被看为一个“中眉的大师”（middlebrow master），阿尔伯特·约翰逊（Albert Johnson）有一个论断屡被后人引用，他称米奈利与马克斯·奥弗斯.

entry.tran: (书、电影等)娱乐的,品位一般的，通俗的
entry.def: If you describe a piece of entertainment such as a book or film as middlebrow, you mean that although it may be interesting and enjoyable, it does not require much thought.

example.ex: ...such middlebrow fare as Poirot, Sherlock Holmes and Jeeves and Wooster.
example.tran: 诸如《大侦探波洛》、《夏洛克·福尔摩斯探案集》、《万能管家》之类的轻松娱乐剧

means.word_mean: 1. someone who is neither a highbrow nor a lowbrow

list.explanation: (智力和趣味均属)中等的 (人)，中产阶级(的)

example.en: There are some who look down on middlebrow interests as trivial.
example.zh: 有些人瞧不起中产阶级的趣味，认为这种趣味毫无价值。

auth_sentence.content: Both were dismissed by them as middlebrow.

auth_sentence.content: Washington retired from public life just when biography was becoming a popular middlebrow genre.

auth_sentence.content: By the time of the first talk-show wars, the demand for middlebrow uplift of the type that Susskind purveyed was shrinking.
